subject: Languages
title: Where New Words Come From
description: One-minute skill: Where New Words Come From.

hook.text: English adds about 1,000 new words every year. Where do they all come from?

buildup.text: New words arrive through borrowing, compounding, blending, shortening, and pure invention.

discovery.text: Brunch is a blend (breakfast + lunch). Blog is a shortening (web log). Selfie is a new coinage.

twist.text: Most new words fail â€” they're used briefly and forgotten. Only a few stick permanently.

climax.text: Shakespeare alone invented about 1,700 words that are still used â€” like 'lonely' and 'bedroom.'

punchline.text: Every word in every language was once brand new. Someone said it first.
